title: How to Carve a Disco Ball Pumpkin

steps.headline: Choose a suitable pumpkin.
steps.description: The pumpkin should be medium to large in size and as round as you can get it––think disco ball when selecting it! Apply the usual pumpkin choosing requirements when selecting––choose a healthy, non-bruised pumpkin. Carve it just before your display date to avoid spoilage.

steps.headline: Cut the lid off the top of the pumpkin.
steps.description: Scoop out the flesh using a strong spoon or other implements. Discard the flesh (or make something vaguely tasty out of it if you're brave––the seeds can be roasted if desired).

steps.headline: Check the base of the pumpkin at this stage.
steps.description: The pumpkin should sit flat. This may necessitate removing some of the base but remember that if you do this, it'll affect where you can place the pumpkin for display or will require a surface for it to sit on (non-flammable surface if using real candles).

steps.headline: Mark the pumpkin drill holes.
steps.description: Work around the pumpkin from top to bottom (or bottom to top) placing dots at evenly spaced intervals in rows around the pumpkin. These are your markers for drilling the holes next.

steps.headline: Drill out the holes.
Place the pumpkin on the surface where it will be displayed.
steps.description: If using live candles, make sure the surface it sits on is non-flammable.

steps.headline: Add the lighting.
steps.description: Either use tea light candles with real flame or use battery-operated versions (LEDs). Make sure it is well lit, as this is a disco ball pumpkin after all!

steps.headline: Clean the pumpkin.
steps.description: Remove any dirt or marks from the surface and allow it to dry before gluing.

steps.headline: Cut up the CDs into jagged pieces of different sizes and shapes.
steps.description:
Wear eye protection and gloves when doing this, to avoid being cut by any potential shards. Alternatively, if you have the time and patience, cut them more evenly to look like the real pieces of a disco ball but be aware that doing this will be time-consuming and potentially frustrating. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/73\/Carve-a-Disco-Ball-Pumpkin-Step-9Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Carve-a-Disco-Ball-Pumpkin-Step-9Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/73\/Carve-a-Disco-Ball-Pumpkin-Step-9Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Carve-a-Disco-Ball-Pumpkin-Step-9Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":325,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":537.6373626373627,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Glue the CD pieces to the pumpkin.
steps.description: Apply them all over the pumpkin, leaving small even gaps between the pieces but don't worry too much about making the pieces appear as if they fit together (unless you're doing the very finicky version).

steps.headline: Use the silver liquid glitter to make a ring around the base of the pumpkin stem.
steps.description:
If anywhere looks naked on the pumpkin, add a few squirts of liquid glitter to infill but this is optional. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/e\/e5\/Carve-a-Disco-Ball-Pumpkin-Step-11Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Carve-a-Disco-Ball-Pumpkin-Step-11Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/e\/e5\/Carve-a-Disco-Ball-Pumpkin-Step-11Bullet1.jpg\/v4-760px-Carve-a-Disco-Ball-Pumpkin-Step-11Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":307,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":507.3626373626374,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Place the pumpkin on display.
steps.description: The CD pumpkin disco ball looks best when light is reflected off it, so place near other lit pumpkins or in the glare of some light, such as a lamp, room light or other light sources.

tyn: Electric drill (and optional drill bit made specifically for this purpose)
Tea light candles and matches or battery-operated tea lights/LEDs
Unwanted CDs––the amount depends on the size of the pumpkin; miniature pumpkins only require one CD, while a large pumpkin will require many
Eye protection (goggles or safety glasses) and flexible gloves
Craft glue or hot glue gun
text:
Drilled pumpkin disco ball Choose a suitable pumpkin. The pumpkin should be medium to large in size and as round as you can get it––think disco ball when selecting it! Apply the usual pumpkin choosing requirements when selecting––choose a healthy, non-bruised pumpkin. Carve it just before your display date to avoid spoilage. Cut the lid off the top of the pumpkin. Scoop out the flesh using a strong spoon or other implements. Discard the flesh (or make something vaguely tasty out of it if you're brave––the seeds can be roasted if desired). Check the base of the pumpkin at this stage. The pumpkin should sit flat. This may necessitate removing some of the base but remember that if you do this, it'll affect where you can place the pumpkin for display or will require a surface for it to sit on (non-flammable surface if using real candles). Mark the pumpkin drill holes. Work around the pumpkin from top to bottom (or bottom to top) placing dots at evenly spaced intervals in rows around the pumpkin. These are your markers for drilling the holes next. Drill out the holes. If you want to be really fancy, there are drill bits designed to do this but really, any electric drill should do the job. The size of the holes is up to you––you can enlarge them by using a "carving" action with the drill as you make the initial hole and simply working at it until the hole is large enough. The best look will come from trying to keep the holes the same shape all the way around. But don't despair if a few are lopsided––it'll still work. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a3/Carve-a-Disco-Ball-Pumpkin-Step-5Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Carve-a-Disco-Ball-Pumpkin-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a3/Carve-a-Disco-Ball-Pumpkin-Step-5Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Carve-a-Disco-Ball-Pumpkin-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":307,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":507.3626373626374,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Don't forget to also drill holes in the lid. It completes the look. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b5/Carve-a-Disco-Ball-Pumpkin-Step-5Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Carve-a-Disco-Ball-Pumpkin-Step-5Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b5/Carve-a-Disco-Ball-Pumpkin-Step-5Bullet2.jpg/v4-760px-Carve-a-Disco-Ball-Pumpkin-Step-5Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":307,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":507.3626373626374,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Place the pumpkin on the surface where it will be displayed. If using live candles, make sure the surface it sits on is non-flammable. Add the lighting. Either use tea light candles with real flame or use battery-operated versions (LEDs). Make sure it is well lit, as this is a disco ball pumpkin after all! Finished. CD pumpkin disco ball Clean the pumpkin. Remove any dirt or marks from the surface and allow it to dry before gluing. Cut up the CDs into jagged pieces of different sizes and shapes. Wear eye protection and gloves when doing this, to avoid being cut by any potential shards. Alternatively, if you have the time and patience, cut them more evenly to look like the real pieces of a disco ball but be aware that doing this will be time-consuming and potentially frustrating. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/73/Carve-a-Disco-Ball-Pumpkin-Step-9Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Carve-a-Disco-Ball-Pumpkin-Step-9Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/73/Carve-a-Disco-Ball-Pumpkin-Step-9Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Carve-a-Disco-Ball-Pumpkin-Step-9Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":325,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":537.6373626373627,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Glue the CD pieces to the pumpkin. Apply them all over the pumpkin, leaving small even gaps between the pieces but don't worry too much about making the pieces appear as if they fit together (unless you're doing the very finicky version). Use the silver liquid glitter to make a ring around the base of the pumpkin stem. If anywhere looks naked on the pumpkin, add a few squirts of liquid glitter to infill but this is optional. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e5/Carve-a-Disco-Ball-Pumpkin-Step-11Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Carve-a-Disco-Ball-Pumpkin-Step-11Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e5/Carve-a-Disco-Ball-Pumpkin-Step-11Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Carve-a-Disco-Ball-Pumpkin-Step-11Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":307,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":507.3626373626374,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Place the pumpkin on display. The CD pumpkin disco ball looks best when light is reflected off it, so place near other lit pumpkins or in the glare of some light, such as a lamp, room light or other light sources.
sentences: Drilled pumpkin disco ball Choose a suitable pumpkin.
The pumpkin should be medium to large in size and as round as you can get it––think disco ball when selecting it!
Apply the usual pumpkin choosing requirements when selecting––choose a healthy, non-bruised pumpkin.
Carve it just before your display date to avoid spoilage.
Cut the lid off the top of the pumpkin.
Scoop out the flesh using a strong spoon or other implements.
Discard the flesh (or make something vaguely tasty out of it if you're brave––the seeds can be roasted if desired).
Check the base of the pumpkin at this stage.
The pumpkin should sit flat.

This may necessitate removing some of the base but remember that if you do this, it'll affect where you can place the pumpkin for display or will require a surface for it to sit on (non-flammable surface if using real candles).
Mark the pumpkin drill holes.
Work around the pumpkin from top to bottom (or bottom to top) placing dots at evenly spaced intervals in rows around the pumpkin.
These are your markers for drilling the holes next.
Drill out the holes.
If you want to be really fancy, there are drill bits designed to do this but really, any electric drill should do the job.
The size of the holes is up to you––you can enlarge them by using a "carving" action with the drill as you make the initial hole and simply working at it until the hole is large enough.
The best look will come from trying to keep the holes the same shape all the way around.
But don't despair if a few are lopsided––it'll still work.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/a\/a3\/Carve-a-Disco-Ball-Pumpkin-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Carve-a-Disco-Ball-Pumpkin-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/a\/a3\/Carve-a-Disco-Ball-Pumpkin-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/v4-760px-Carve-a-Disco-Ball-Pumpkin-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":307,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":507.3626373626374,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Don't forget to also drill holes in the lid.
It completes the look.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/b\/b5\/Carve-a-Disco-Ball-Pumpkin-Step-5Bullet2.jpg\/v4-460px-Carve-a-Disco-Ball-Pumpkin-Step-5Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/b\/b5\/Carve-a-Disco-Ball-Pumpkin-Step-5Bullet2.jpg\/v4-760px-Carve-a-Disco-Ball-Pumpkin-Step-5Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":307,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":507.3626373626374,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Place the pumpkin on the surface where it will be displayed.
If using live candles, make sure the surface it sits on is non-flammable.
Add the lighting.
Either use tea light candles with real flame or use battery-operated versions (LEDs).
Make sure it is well lit, as this is a disco ball pumpkin after all!
Finished.
CD pumpkin disco ball Clean the pumpkin.
Remove any dirt or marks from the surface and allow it to dry before gluing.
Cut up the CDs into jagged pieces of different sizes and shapes.
Wear eye protection and gloves when doing this, to avoid being cut by any potential shards.
Alternatively, if you have the time and patience, cut them more evenly to look like the real pieces of a disco ball but be aware that doing this will be time-consuming and potentially frustrating.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/73\/Carve-a-Disco-Ball-Pumpkin-Step-9Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Carve-a-Disco-Ball-Pumpkin-Step-9Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/73\/Carve-a-Disco-Ball-Pumpkin-Step-9Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Carve-a-Disco-Ball-Pumpkin-Step-9Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":325,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":537.6373626373627,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Glue the CD pieces to the pumpkin.

Apply them all over the pumpkin, leaving small even gaps between the pieces but don't worry too much about making the pieces appear as if they fit together (unless you're doing the very finicky version).
Use the silver liquid glitter to make a ring around the base of the pumpkin stem.
If anywhere looks naked on the pumpkin, add a few squirts of liquid glitter to infill but this is optional.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/e\/e5\/Carve-a-Disco-Ball-Pumpkin-Step-11Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Carve-a-Disco-Ball-Pumpkin-Step-11Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/e\/e5\/Carve-a-Disco-Ball-Pumpkin-Step-11Bullet1.jpg\/v4-760px-Carve-a-Disco-Ball-Pumpkin-Step-11Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":307,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":507.3626373626374,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Place the pumpkin on display.
The CD pumpkin disco ball looks best when light is reflected off it, so place near other lit pumpkins or in the glare of some light, such as a lamp, room light or other light sources.
